intro: Calochone, commonly known as the African orchid, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plants typically grow as herbaceous perennials, with some species developing into shrubs. Calochone species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Their flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and pink, making them popular in horticultural collections.
